item.title: “I Love Him to Death”: Take-Two CEO On Gearbox’s Randy Pitchford
item.content:encoded:
Take-Two CEO Strauss Zelnick “loves” Gearbox boss Randy Pitchford despite some of his recent comments.

In a recent interview, Zelnick was asked about Pitchford’s recent comments, such as telling a fan that if they were a “real fan” of Borderlands, they would spend $80 on Borderlands 4 if that was the price.

For Zelnick, that’s just part of Pitchford’s “big personality”

“I love Randy, first of all. Let me just say that on the record,” Zelnick told IGN. “And I love his big personality. I love his passion and he is one of the all time great game makers. He also can be controversial at times — sometimes intentionally, sometimes unintentionally. I still love him to death.”

For his part, Pitchford addressed the “real fans” comment saying he didn’t mean any harm with his words while acknowledging players being frustrated with price increases.

Circling back to Borderlands 4 itself, the first mainline game in the series since 2019’s Borderlands 3, the base edition price ultimately remained the standard $70 that has been common for years. The game is scheduled to release on September 12 for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X|S, and PC. The Nintendo Switch 2 version will launch just weeks later on October 3.

item.title: EXCLUSIVE: Marvel Rivals Planning ‘Collaborations with Other Marvel Titles’
item.content:encoded:
More collaborations with other Marvel titles are coming to Marvel Rivals in the future, Game Director Guangguang has confirmed to Insider Gaming.

Marvel Rivals has seen regular updates bringing costumes and looks from other Marvel media into the title, including some from other games, and that shows no signs of stopping.

Speaking exclusively to Insider Gaming at the Marvel Rivals Ignite Mid-Season Finals in Guangzhou, Guangguang would not elaborate on specifics with the plans but confirmed they are on the agenda.

More Collabs Coming to Marvel Rivals

Asked whether collaborations with other Marvel games are on the cards, including the upcoming Marvel Tokon: Fighting Souls, Guangguang did not confirm whether that specific title would be featured in collaborations but confirmed “future plans on collaborations with other Marvel titles.”

While this isn’t too surprising, given the game already features a Spider-Man costume based on the Insomniac series, albeit a PlayStation exclusive, it’s still exciting news for players—particularly given the slew of upcoming Marvel titles in the works, including Insomniac’s Wolverine, EA’s Iron Man, and Arkane’s Lyon.

Marvel Rivals has also had collaborations outside of the Marvel sphere, including with Fortnite, and teased “maybe” when asked if similar collaborations with Epic Games could happen in the future.

There will also be a continuation with collaborations with other Marvel properties, as Guangguang confirmed discussions with Marvel Studios, Marvel Animation, and Disney+. In future, releases could be timed to coincide simulataneously with other media forms, bringing new costumes and locations into the game at the same time as movie releases, for examples.
